dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Don't think I've seen you around. That means you must be new to Stellar Bay. You are new here, right?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Whatever, I'm not here for chit-chat.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You seem surprised.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wait! Don't go just yet. I've been practicing for this. Here goes.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: On behalf of Monarch Stellar Industries, welcome to Stellar Bay, home of the freshest saltuna in Halcyon. Please state your name for the records.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Captain <oeitoken>PlayerName</oeitoken>.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Me? I'm Alex Hawthorne.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I prefer to travel discreetly, if you know what I mean.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't have time for this.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Swell, there's one for the logs! I'm even gonna give you your own entry code.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm not supposed to do that - it's against procedure - but Mr. Sanjar isn't so strict about the rules here. Besides, I got a lot of empty entries to fill.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Is Stellar Bay really THAT isolated?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're not what I expected to find on Monarch.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm gonna have a look around town.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: We don't get ship traffic in town. Only offworlders who do make it out here are SubLight - they got a base in Fallbrook.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: And thank the stars for them, or we would've run out of Rizzo's Purpleberry Crunch years ago.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, that'll just make Mr. Sanjar's day if you tell him. The Board makes up lots of nasty stories about raptidons and cannibals and whatnot.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: But that's all outside our walls. Mostly.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Mr. Sanjar'll be mighty pleased to meet you. If you see him over at headquarters, maybe you could tell him I did a bang-up job of welcoming you?

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, and if you're headed that way, maybe you could do me a favor?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That depends. What is it?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I don't have time for this.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: I got this Rizzo's Rangers tossball poster coming in on the next SubLight shipment. Signed by the Black Hole himself!

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Only, I haven't heard anything in a while. You think you could check with Celia to see if it's come in?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sure, I can ask about your poster.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Who's the Black Hole?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: This poster sounds pretty valuable.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Thanks a bunch! Celia works for Mr. Sanjar in the MSI building, next to the bar. She's always there, so you can't miss her.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: That's Bertie Holcomb! Only one of the greatest tossball hackers ever.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Everyone's heard of him - even on Monarch, we still get some of the games. You been living in a sulfur pit or something?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Whatever, I don't really care.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Actually, I've been in hibernation for decades.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: But why's he called the Black Hole?

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Aw, you must be a Hammers fan for sure.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Aw, you're real funny. Guess I don't feel so bad for missing what goes on in the rest of Stellar Bay.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: On account of him being the best hacker who ever played! Nothing gets by him - he sucks up every ball that comes his way.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Okay, that's all I ever need to hear on that subject.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Maybe word that differently.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Whatever you say! I could talk tossball for hours.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, Holcomb's had lots of nicknames over his career. Used to be the Tally Whacker on account of what he'd do to the score.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Before that he was the Slick Stick 'cause his shots were always so smooth.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Let's not talk about this ever again.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're making this up.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: I swear I'm not! At the start of his career, people called him the Hack Boss, but no one thought that was very catchy.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: I couldn't really say - I'm just a fan of the game.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: But the fancy collector types say the more people see these things, the less valuable they are. And I figure my poster's been passed around by more than a few people by now.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Aw, don't be like that. I never get to do this part!

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Please?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Fine. I'm Captain <oeitoken>PlayerName</oeitoken>.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I go by Alex Hawthorne.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Don't make me tell you twice.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sorry. I've got business elsewhere.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: H-hey, easy. I won't stop you.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Business? Well, Mr. Sanjar's gonna like the sound of that.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: You must've seen those UDL gunships on your way in. There's only three of 'em these days. Still, they tend to scare folk off.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What are they doing out there?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Takes more than a few gunships to scare me.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: You may not have heard - you being new - but Stellar Bay hardly ever gets offworld traffic. Us being cut off by the Board and all.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Which means I never get to do this part. But I've been practicing! So here goes.

dialog.speaker: Grimm (Male)
dialog.utterance: Wish more folk could say that. Gets awful quiet guarding a landing pad that never gets used.
